title: Why do we see illusions? - Mark Changizi

multiple-choice.question: Why do we see illusions, according to the speaker's research?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brains are not capable of processing complex visual information.

options.label: B
options.text: Because our brains are slow and try to compensate for the delay in perception.

options.label: C
options.text: Because our brains are tricked by the simplicity of the visual stimuli.

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brains are not evolved to handle natural stimuli.

options.label: D
